intro: Scoparebutia, commonly known as the desert rose or moon cactus, is a genus of flowering plants native to the arid regions of South America. These succulent plants are characterized by their thick, fleshy stems and showy, often brightly colored flowers. They thrive in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to prevent root rot. Scoparebutia species are prized for their resilience and ornamental value in dry gardens.
